meanings.definition: To become aware or understand something
meanings.sent1: After listening carefully, she was cottoning on to the new concept.
meanings.sent2: The students were cottoning to the idea of a field trip.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be cottoning on to the fact that the treats were hidden in the cupboard.
meanings.sent4: As the sun rose, the sleepy town started cottoning on to the idea of a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: Her face lit up as she finally started cottoning on to the surprise party waiting for her.

meanings.definition: To form a liking or understanding of something
meanings.sent1: The child was cottoning to the idea of having a pet puppy.
meanings.sent2: Slowly but surely, he was cottoning to the taste of spicy food.
meanings.sent3: The old dog was cottoning to the idea of napping in the sun all day.
meanings.sent4: She found herself cottoning to the charm of the small seaside town.
meanings.sent5: The audience was cottoning to the comedian's jokes, erupting into laughter.
